programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Topical comedy quiz show, hosted by Dara O Briain. Regular panellist Hugh Dennis looks back on another eventful week in news and politics, with the help of with the help of guests Angela Barnes, Ed Gamble, Rhys James, Nish Kumar and Tiff Stevenson. Stand-up and improvisation are the name of the game as the contestants try to get one up on each other.

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Extended edition. Question master Stephen Fry continues the comedy quiz's exploration of subjects beginning with the letter L as he asks a range of fiendish questions on the topics of luck and loss. programme.title: QI XL

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: In an episode originally shown in 2011, Jeremy Clarkson celebrates the 50th anniversary of the Jaguar E-type by driving a modern-day interpretation of the classic sports car, and throws a typically low-key party involving live music, fighter planes and the Royal Marines. Richard Hammond is in South Africa, where he tests the Marauder, a bigger, more rugged alternative to the Humvee, and James May enlists the help of 2010 Winter Olympic skeleton gold medallist Amy Williams and former Intercontinental Rally Challenge champion Kris Meeke to try out a Mini rally car. Plus, the Stig takes the BMW 1 Series M Coupe around the test track and Alice Cooper gets behind the wheel of the Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Cops UK: Bodycam Squad
programme.desc: Two males on bikes are spotted acting suspiciously near a cashpoint. One evades police and a pursuit ensues. A police dog undertakes its final shift.

programme.title: Cops UK: Bodycam Squad
programme.desc: A group of angry locals trap an innocent man in a telephone box and accuse him of being a paedophile, and a woman claims her boyfriend is trying to kill her.

programme.title: Cops UK: Bodycam Squad
programme.desc: Keith engages in a high-speed pursuit after spotting a car being driven with a flat tyre. Even after the tyre disintegrates at 90mph, the driver still refuses to stop.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May immerse themselves in nostalgia and try to prove that hot hatches from their younger days are better than today's equivalents. Jeremy grabs the keys to a Volkswagen Golf GTI, Richard takes the wheel of a Vauxhall Nova SRi and James May opts for the Ford Fiesta XR2i, and the trio set off on a road trip that includes a hill climb and a visit to a supermarket. However, their adventure concludes at an army training ground in Wales, where they and their steeds must face the heavily armed Top Gear Police Department. Downton Abbey star Hugh Bonneville blasts the Reasonably Priced Car around the test track.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: The trio travel to Italy to test high-performance hatchbacks. Jeremy Clarkson is in the Citroen DS3 Racing, Richard Hammond champions the Fiat 500C Abarth and James May makes the case for the Renaultsport Clio 200 Cup as they navigate their way round baffling Italian towns and take part in a scavenger hunt, before putting the cars through their paces on the F1 street circuit in Monaco. Also, petrolhead comedian Ross Noble is in the Reasonably Priced Car and the McLaren MP4-12C supercar comes under review.

programme.title: Scrapyard Supercar
programme.desc: Pro driver Shane Lynch takes on engineer Ralph Hosier and his teams of mechanics, who are aiming to prove a supercar can be beaten by homemade scrap. This time, they get down and dirty in an off-road scramble versus the Bentley Bentayga - can a car synonymous with class and style be beaten by cars made from cast-offs?.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Actor Larry Lamb, comedian David O'Doherty and presenter Lauren Laverne join host Frank Skinner, making the case for their pet hates to be banished for ever. The trio's dislikes include high fives, fancy dress, ostentatious dresses, being 35, fake tan and square plates.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Seasoned rocker Alice Cooper, Who Wants to Be a Millionaire? host Chris Tarrant and wildlife presenter Chris Packham compete to have their pet hates banished for ever, on the comedy panel show chaired by Frank Skinner. Their gripes include reality TV stars, balloon animals, parrots, Jedward, Chris Moyles and kids' artwork on fridges.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Frank Skinner chairs the comedy panel show, inviting comedian Ross Noble, R'n'B singer Jamelia and academic Germaine Greer to compete to have their pet hates banished for ever. Their gripes include folk-dancing, health-and-safety, text speak, smelly people, actors and fun-runs.

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lucy attends a three-day trade conference to drum up business, but when she has little luck she resorts to flirting with the male delegates. Lee is outraged with her plan, however, and in an attempt to stop her he turns up at the event - posing as her husband. Comedy, starring Lee Mack and Sally Bretton.

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lee gets jealous when Lucy talks about her first love, so Daisy helps him turn the tables by setting him up with her gorgeous friend. However, he is surprised when things start moving very quickly between them. Comedy, guest starring Joanna Bobin (Secret Diary of a Call Girl), with Lee Mack, Sally Bretton and Katy Wix.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May immerse themselves in nostalgia and try to prove that hot hatches from their younger days are better than today's equivalents. Jeremy grabs the keys to a Volkswagen Golf GTI, Richard takes the wheel of a Vauxhall Nova SRi and James May opts for the Ford Fiesta XR2i, and the trio set off on a road trip that includes a hill climb and a visit to a supermarket. However, their adventure concludes at an army training ground in Wales, where they and their steeds must face the heavily armed Top Gear Police Department. Downton Abbey star Hugh Bonneville blasts the Reasonably Priced Car around the test track.

programme.title: Ultimate Movers
programme.sub-title: Beer Silo, Plane Bar, Steam Train
programme.desc: A 32-metre long beer tank must navigate tiny roads to be installed at a brewery in Tadcaster, while in Kidderminster, a vintage steam train travels hundreds of miles south to Devon.

programme.title: Steve Austin's Broken Skull Challenge

programme.title: Cops UK: Bodycam Squad
programme.desc: A car that had failed to stop then reverses at speed down a footpath, hitting the door of a police car. Officers assist security guards in a tower block by removing two women.

programme.title: Cops UK: Bodycam Squad

programme.title: Room 101

programme.title: Room 101

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Former Labour home secretary Alan Johnson takes over the reins for extended edition of the satirical quiz, with comedian Janey Godley and journalist and political commentator Tim Shipman joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the stories making the headlines.

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Sara Pascoe, Colin Lane and Jimmy Carr join regular panellist Alan Davies and host Sandi Toksvig for an extended edition of the comedy panel quiz show. This time, the theme is 'Opposites'. During the course of the show, the panellists find out how to sort the sheep from the goats, discover the opposite of Tarzan, and meet the telescope that points straight through the Earth. As ever, correctness and even intelligence go out of the window, as the fiendishly difficult questions lead to points being awarded for the answers its questionmaster finds most interesting, as opposed to correct.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: An account of Hitler's decision to invade the Soviet Union, which produced an initial series of dazzling victories until the harsh winter of 1941 took hold, with fatal consequences for the ill-equipped German army. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: Experts analyse the work of engineers including Sir Nigel Gresley, who engineered the world's fastest steam train in 1938 and Eric Laithwaite, whose linear motor made frictionless travel a possibility. These innovators influenced the engineering of the Shanghai Maglev, the fastest passenger train in operation on Earth, which broke numerous engineering boundaries in its construction. Held in place by a series of electromagnets, it levitates on an air gap of 10mm and is able to reach a top speed of 431kms per hour.

programme.title: Medieval Dead
programme.desc: The skeleton dubbed the Warrior of Janakkala, found in Finland. The swords buried alongside the man suggest a link between Christians and Pagans and it has been deduced the remains date from the 12th century.

programme.title: Medieval Dead
programme.desc: The team travels to Montsegur in France to investigate the massacre of hundreds of Cathars in 1244.

programme.title: Royal Murder Mysteries
programme.desc: The crime documentary continues, shedding light on rumours that Princess Anastasia, daughter of Tsar Nicholas II, managed to escape death at the hands of the Bolsheviks in 1918.

programme.title: Impossible Railways
programme.desc: Unusual rail networks designed to traverse water, including the Indian Ocean, the earthquake zones of the Bosphorus Strait and the sea cliffs of the Italian Riviera.

programme.title: Impossible Railways
programme.desc: The drive to make trains faster, from supersonic rocket sleds to engines that seem to fly above their guideways.

programme.title: Impossible Railways
programme.desc: Since their meteoric rise in the 19th Century, railways have been at the forefront of modern engineering. They've conquered dizzying altitudes, wilderness, seas and cities..

programme.title: Impossible Railways
programme.desc: Since their rise in the 19th Century, railways have been at the forefront of modern engineering and transport, conquering dizzying altitudes, wilderness, seas and cities..

programme.title: Wonders of the Monsoon
programme.desc: Colin Salmon narrates a documentary exploring how the lives of humans and animals across a vast area of the planet are affected by the transforming power of the monsoon rains. The end of the dry season in northern Australia sees 300,000 flying foxes gathering to drink while running a gauntlet of freshwater crocodiles, while in Sumatra a female orang-utan guides her youngster to where she knows a fig tree fruits at this time of year. At the Delhi stock exchange, the price of rice escalates every day the rains fail to materialise and priests submerge themselves in water and beseech Varuna, god of water, to come.

programme.title: Wonders of the Monsoon
programme.desc: The effect of the rainy season on wildlife in Asia, with floods forcing animals to flee from Kaziranga National Park in north-east India in search of the safety of the hills. In Cambodia, the Mekong river swells so much that water is forced back up one of its tributaries to fill the vast Tonle Sap lake - one of the most productive freshwater fisheries on Earth. Fresh grass draws nomads and their vast herds of livestock back to their homelands, but they are stalked by hungry wolves and hyenas, which move in at night for the kill. Colin Salmon narrates.

programme.title: Wonders of the Monsoon
programme.desc: The other side of the monsoon, as the winds bring dry air and drought. Budgerigars swarm in the Australian desert, gathering at a precious waterhole, and although birds of prey try to ambush them, they are mesmerised by the array of bright colours on show. On the island of Borneo, a bearded pig hunts for seafood on the beach, while in the Rajasthan desert, nomads haggle over the price of camels, which can provide vital transport during this lean season. The mugger crocodiles of Sri Lanka stalk the animals taking a much-needed drink and a young leopard learning to hunt discovers there is no such thing as an easy meal. Colin Salmon narrates.

programme.title: Guitar Heroes at the BBC
programme.desc: Status Quo play Pictures of Matchstick Men on Top of the Pops in 1968, the Who perform Long Live Rock in the Old Grey Whistle Test studio, Dire Straits deliver Tunnel of Love and Lynyrd Skynyrd bring a taste of the American South with Sweet Home Alabama. The programme also features rare performances from George Benson, Leo Kottke, Link Wray and Tom Petty.

programme.title: Guitar Heroes at the BBC
programme.desc: Archive footage from BBC music shows of the 1970s. Including electric performances by the Rolling Stones, Eric Clapton, David Bowie, Motorhead, Nazareth, AC/DC and George Thorogood, as well as acoustic material by Michael Chapman, Horslips and Paco de Lucia.

programme.title: The Queen's Castle
programme.desc: The Knights of the Garter arrive at Windsor Castle for their annual lunch with members of the monarchy, which includes a complicated procession through the palace. The royal archives allow cameras to view nearly 200 years of photo albums, including the thousands of photographs from the Queen Mother's collection, and the castle clock-maker faces a race to ensure all 450 timepieces on the estate are turned back.

programme.title: World's Greatest Palaces
programme.desc: Behind the scenes of Schnbrunn Palace in Austria, which is located in a 500-acre park and includes an orangery, palm house and one of Europe's oldest zoos.

programme.title: David Jason: Planes, Trains and Automobiles
programme.desc: The actor discovers the machines that made America. Here, he samples the luxury of 1930s aviation, drives the car that changed the world and climbs aboard a vintage steam train.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: A multi-billion-pound 32km super sewer under the streets of London, an early sewer system at the Palace of Knossos and a pivotal piece of tunnel boring equipment from the past.

programme.title: Secrets of the Bible
programme.desc: Documentary offering an insight into some of the events in the Bible, beginning with the story of the Ten Plagues. In the Old Testament, the Book of Exodus describes the epic battle between the prophet Moses and Pharaoh. Experts offer various various explanations for the 10 plagues of Moses and the mass exodus of the Hebrew slaves out of Egypt, a story that is a cornerstone of the Jewish, Christian, and Muslim faiths.

programme.title: Secrets of the Bible
programme.desc: Investigating the Turin Shroud, which is a length of linen cloth that some believe bears the image of Jesus. Cameras follow the efforts of a scientist trying to prove whether the cloth truly is Christ's burial robe.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: Acclaimed chronicle of the Second World War, beginning with an account of Hitler's ascent to power at a time when the Germans were stricken by humiliating military defeat, runaway inflation and economic depression. The Nazi leader's promises of regained national pride and prosperity struck a chord with millions of ordinary citizens, and he was elected on a tidal wave of popular support. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: The months following prime minister Neville Chamberlain's declaration of war against Germany, in which the only casualties on the home front were those who had to endure the blackouts. Elsewhere in Europe, the Nazi war machine cut a swathe of destruction. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: How, in 1940, the French Army suffered a heavy defeat after underestimating the Nazis' strength while relying on First World War strategies and equipment to defend its frontiers. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: The drop in morale of Churchill's forces following the fall of France to Nazi forces during the Second World War, and how the Dunkirk evacuation and the Battle of Britain helped to restore British confidence. Plus, America's reasons for initially refusing to enter the conflict.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: An account of Hitler's decision to invade the Soviet Union, which produced an initial series of dazzling victories until the harsh winter of 1941 took hold, with fatal consequences for the ill-equipped German army. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: Secrets of Britain
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the somewhat macabre history of Scotland Yard, and revealing the lesser-known facts about one of the world's most famous police stations.

programme.title: Secrets of Britain
programme.sub-title: Secrets of Her Majesty's Secret Service
programme.desc: The documentary series exploring the less well known side of Britain continues, with this edition exploring MI6, asking whether the shadowy world of espionage and counter-intelligence operations bear any resemblance to the James Bond novels.

programme.title: Secrets of the Manor House
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the story of Highclere Castle, the setting used for TV drama Downton Abbey, including an insight into the lives of current residents Lord and Lady Carnarvon.

programme.title: Secrets of the Manor House
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the hidden history of the stately home in Derbyshire, the residence of the dukes of Devonshire, revealing tales of intrigue, tragedy and scandal.

programme.title: Murder Maps
programme.desc: The case of Dr Crippen, who murdered his wife and buried her in the basement before fleeing to Canada.

programme.title: Murder Maps
programme.sub-title: The Brides In The Bath Killer
programme.desc: The case of George Smith, who married a succession of women and murdered them so he could inherit their wealth.

programme.title: Murder Maps
programme.desc: Part one of two. A re-examination of Jack The Ripper's crimes, revealing how the story we know today was shaped by the sensationalist press of 1888.

programme.title: 'Allo 'Allo!
programme.desc: Michelle tells Ren and the others that two British experts are coming disguised as policemen to examine the Enigma machine.

programme.title: 'Allo 'Allo!
programme.desc: German generals plan to meet at the cafe disguised as onion sellers, but so does a new group of shot-down British airmen. Second World War comedy set in German-occupied France, starring Gorden Kaye.

programme.title: 'Allo 'Allo!
programme.desc: Helga tells Von Strohm that the stolen money was forged, so he thinks up a plan to get rid of the cash, while Michelle and Crabtree hatch a plot to get the airmen back to England.

programme.title: 'Allo 'Allo!
programme.desc: General Von Klinkerhoffen is declared insane and taken to the hospital's psychiatric ward. Colonel Von Strohm, Herr Flick and Von Smallhausen become tied to a bomb in the sewer, while Fanny and Monsieur Le Clerc have problems on their wedding day.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: A rare 1980s Sierra Cosworth draws in a crowd of admiring Ford fans, while a restorer delights buyers with his immaculate 1966 Sunbeam Rapier and Sarah takes a shine to a caravan.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A formerly luxurious and strategic mountain-top villa on the island of Rhodes in the Mediterranean that's been ravaged by acts of revenge by locals since 1955.

programme.title: War Factories
programme.desc: The untold secret story of war production that shaped the Second World War, beginning with how the German aviation industry came to dominate the skies of Europe.

programme.title: Secrets of the Bible
programme.desc: Documentary offering an insight into some of the events in the Bible, beginning with the story of the Ten Plagues. In the Old Testament, the Book of Exodus describes the epic battle between the prophet Moses and Pharaoh. Experts offer various various explanations for the 10 plagues of Moses and the mass exodus of the Hebrew slaves out of Egypt, a story that is a cornerstone of the Jewish, Christian, and Muslim faiths.

programme.title: Secrets of the Bible
programme.desc: Investigating the Turin Shroud, which is a length of linen cloth that some believe bears the image of Jesus. Cameras follow the efforts of a scientist trying to prove whether the cloth truly is Christ's burial robe.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Full Steam Ahead
programme.desc: The team discover how the combination of increased leisure time and affordable rail transport brought a new kind of freedom for working-class Victorians. Ruth Goodman travels along the south Devon coast from Paignton to Kingswear, where she helps prepare a paddle steamer for a journey up the River Dart, while at Swanage, Peter Ginn finds out what it was like to work on the excursion trains and the impact mass tourism had on the area.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: A look at the Airbus A380, which as the largest passenger plane ever built can carry more than 850 people non-stop nearly half-way around the world. With the largest wingspan of any commercial aircraft and four specially developed mighty turbo jet engines, the A380 weighs 560 tonnes and getting it off the ground would not have been possible without the work of past innovators such as George Cayley and Frank Whittle. Key developments in aerospace engineering - from Richard Whitcombe's energy-efficient wing-tip designs to Nasa engineers' cutting-edge control system, Fly by Wire - helped bring the A380 to fruition.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: How Europe's most advanced power station became a film set. Plus, the structures made by scientific pioneer Nikola Tesla in his quest to provide the US with free electricity.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: Laurence Olivier narrates this documentary chronicling events leading up to the Japanese attack on Pearl Harbour on December 7, 1941, and the subsequent collapse of unprepared British forces before the advancing enemy in Singapore. Includes interviews with veterans from both sides.

programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.desc: Jamie Theakston travels to Jerusalem in search of Solomon's Temple. When the Romans sacked the city in 70AD, the fabled Treasure of Solomons was believed to have been looted and taken back to Rome. However, it is possible it was hidden away by the High Priests. Archaeologists Dr Shimon Gibson and Kate Raphael have dedicated their lives working out what actually happened, and discuss whether it is possible that Solomonic and Roman treasures lie undiscovered under Jerusalem.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: A look at the Airbus A380, which as the largest passenger plane ever built can carry more than 850 people non-stop nearly half-way around the world. With the largest wingspan of any commercial aircraft and four specially developed mighty turbo jet engines, the A380 weighs 560 tonnes and getting it off the ground would not have been possible without the work of past innovators such as George Cayley and Frank Whittle. Key developments in aerospace engineering - from Richard Whitcombe's energy-efficient wing-tip designs to Nasa engineers' cutting-edge control system, Fly by Wire - helped bring the A380 to fruition.

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.desc: Tony Robinson hikes up from Lyme Regis on Dorset's Jurassic Coast to the Somerset Levels in the footsteps of a ragtag rebel army led by the young Duke of Monmouth, the illegitimate son of Charles II. He sailed in from Holland around Lyme's famous Cobb with a handful of soldiers, believing the people would support him in overthrowing the newly crowned James II, who was also Monmouth's uncle, but, more importantly, Roman Catholic. The year was 1685 and the country was riven by anti-Catholic feeling mixed up with revolutionary zeal. Monmouth marched through the fiercely independent towns of Devon, gathering support from artisans and farmworkers. Meeting up with Billy Bragg in Colyton, Tony learns about the kind of people prepared to risk their lives for the Monmouth Rebellion.

programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.desc: Jamie Theakston talks to author Joy Hancox about the alchemical roots of London, the design of famous buildings such as The Globe theatre and the mysterious figure of English poet John Byrom. He also meets a modern day potion-maker.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: Veteran naturalist David Attenborough explores the fragile marine ecosystem of the coral reef, where all creatures, including the corals themselves, have to fight for survival. From tiny beginnings, the reef grows and develops over hundreds of years, providing support for innumerable animals - yet one storm can threaten the entire community.

programme.title: Train Truckers
programme.desc: Kevin Norris and Kieran Chisnall move three state-of-the-art trains, fresh in from Japan. They need to transport them from the North East port of Redcar to a factory in Doncaster.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: How Europe's most advanced power station became a film set. Plus, the structures made by scientific pioneer Nikola Tesla in his quest to provide the US with free electricity.

programme.title: The World at War

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: A look at the Airbus A380, which as the largest passenger plane ever built can carry more than 850 people non-stop nearly half-way around the world. With the largest wingspan of any commercial aircraft and four specially developed mighty turbo jet engines, the A380 weighs 560 tonnes and getting it off the ground would not have been possible without the work of past innovators such as George Cayley and Frank Whittle. Key developments in aerospace engineering - from Richard Whitcombe's energy-efficient wing-tip designs to Nasa engineers' cutting-edge control system, Fly by Wire - helped bring the A380 to fruition.

programme.title: Slow Train Through Africa with Griff Rhys Jones
programme.desc: The comedian makes five train journeys taking in the spectacular sights of Africa, travelling to unexpected places in deserts and forests, villages and cities, and finding out how the railways are used today. He begins in the north, on a line that links the trading cities of Morocco, Algeria and Tunisia. Stocking up for his trip at a souk in Marrakesh, he boards the train for a seven-hour ride to the ancient city of Fes, and eventually reaches the Sahara - and his final destination of Tozeur.

programme.desc: The comedian attempts to zigzag his way 1,200 miles through Kenya and Tanzania, beginning this leg of his journey on a vintage steam locomotive designed in Glasgow. On a cattle farm established by an aristocrat a century ago, he dons a pair of overalls and joins workers as they bathe more than 2,000 animals to ward off parasites and biting flies. Later, in the vast Tsavo East National Park, he bottle-feeds orphaned elephant calves, before visiting a Maasai village - where he quickly regrets a faux pas during a meat feast.

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.desc: It was 30 years after the Romans invaded Britain that they were ready to take on the challenge of conquering the Lake District. With the toughest landscape they had encountered in the nation, peopled by a rebellious tribe, it was no small task, but within a few years, the whole of Lakeland was under their control. Tony Robinson tackles the journey by himself, walking 50 miles from Penrith to Ambleside and on to the Irish Sea at Ravenglass, discovering that the Romans encountered beauty and danger in equal measure.

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.desc: Tony Robinson takes a four-day trek along the coastline between Plymouth in Devon and Falmouth, learning about the thriving smuggling trade in Cornwall during the late 18th century. The area's tiny secretive harbours, beaches and secluded coves were ideal for illicit imports such as tobacco and brandy, and the business was so huge it threatened the national economy. Along his route, visiting such beauty spots as Lantic Bay and Polperro, he encounters all sorts of reminders of the trade and meets descendants of those involved.

programme.desc: David Attenborough travels to the Arctic and Antarctic to explore the wildernesses at Earth's poles, investigating the wildlife and geographical features found there. programme.desc: The sisters face up to the realities of life with their husbands in prison, and try to explain things to Tracey's son, Garth. Classic comedy, starring Pauline Quirke and Linda Robson.

programme.title: Cadfael
programme.desc: A juggler seeks sanctuary at the abbey, desperate to escape an angry mob who believe he attacked and robbed a goldsmith. Sensing that events are not what they seem, Cadfael investigates - and it is not long before another body is found floating in the river. Medieval mystery, starring Derek Jacobi.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: The roguish antiques dealer is arrested on suspicion of armed robbery - and to make matters worse, the only way he can clear his name is by admitting he was with a charming ex-girlfriend at the time. He must decide whether to come clean and face a jealous Charlotte's wrath, or take the consequences of the charge. Ian McShane stars.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: A penniless sculptor seeks the canny dealer's help to prise a considerable inheritance out of his avaricious brother. Celia Imrie guest stars, with Ian McShane.

programme.title: Sharpe
programme.desc: Sean Bean returns as Bernard Cornwell's swashbuckling hero, this time setting out to rescue British deserters captured by Spanish rebel El Casco. Along the way he crosses swords with a fellow officer and come to the aid of a damsel in distress. Daragh O'Malley, Hugh Fraser and John Tams also star.

programme.title: Auf Wiedersehen, Pet
programme.desc: The group arrives in Germany with hopes of high wages and bierkellers full of frauleins, but the truth is much harder to bear. Dick Clement and Ian La Frenais's popular comic drama following the fortunes of English workers seeking their fortune overseas, starring Tim Healy, Kevin Whately, Timothy Spall and Jimmy Nail.

programme.title: Auf Wiedersehen, Pet
programme.desc: Neville is suspended for lying about being a joiner, but manages to redeem himself by averting a disaster on the site. He is not only reinstated by Herr Ulrich, but allowed to work as a bricklayer - which is bad news for Oz, who is sacked to make way for him. Drama, starring Tim Healy, Kevin Whately, Timothy Spall and Jimmy Nail.

programme.title: The Evacuees
programme.desc: Jack Rosenthal's 1975 drama, directed by Alan Parker, chronicling the experiences of two Jewish boys evacuated from London to avoid the horrors of the Blitz. Maureen Lipman, Margery Mason and Ray Mort star.

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: The priest investigates the disappearance of a parishioner who believed she was being haunted by her sister, who went missing years before. Mark Williams stars in the 1950s-set crime drama based on the stories by GK Chesterton, with Sorcha Cusack, Hugo Speer and Tom Chambers.

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: An ex-serviceman dies suddenly in the street, and Father Brown is called to investigate Danvers Retreat, a facility where the dead man was a patient. Fifties-set crime drama based on the stories by GK Chesterton, starring Mark Williams.

programme.title: The Brokenwood Mysteries
programme.desc: The annual wine show is a major event in Brokenwood and no one is looking forward to it more than DI Mike, the recent buyer of a 10-acre vineyard. However, when a guest judge and wine critic are found dead, drowned inside a fermenting vat, the show takes second place to the murder investigation. Neill Rea, Fern Sutherland, Pana Hema Taylor and Nic Sampson star.

programme.title: Frankie Drake Mysteries
programme.desc: Mob boss Bessie Starkman hires Frankie and Trudy to work at her illegal casino as a waitress and croupier, but Frankie ends up accused of murder.

programme.title: Wallander
programme.desc: Two bodies are discovered on a life raft in Ystad harbour, the victims having been shot through the head and had their tongues burnt off with acid. The heavily tattooed corpses reveal links to the Russian mob and are instrumental in proving the men originated from Latvia, so Major Karlis Liepa, an officer with the country's police department, is sent to work with Wallander. But an anonymous phone call, a shooting and a break-in at the police HQ soon convince Wallander of a leak in the investigation - and he immediately suspects Liepa. Guest starring Soren Malling (The Killing), with Kenneth Branagh as the world-weary detective.

credits.actor: Kenneth Branagh as the world-weary detective

programme.title: Kavanagh QC
programme.desc: A single mother from Sunderland asks Kavanagh to prosecute the neighbourhood vigilante she suspects of attempting to murder her teenage tearaway son in a hit-and-run incident. At first he has misgivings about accepting a case so far from home, but finally agrees _ only to find his already strained family life suffering as a result. Tense legal drama, starring John Thaw and Lisa Harrow, with a guest appearance by Robert Glenister.

programme.desc: Kerry exacts revenge on David Radford by sabotaging his planned armed robbery, but Irene turns the tables by producing an incriminating tape. Andrea and Gabriel are both given ultimatums and Adam is furious when information about the Sun Hill sniper is leaked to the newspapers.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Part one of two. Kerry does a disappearing act, leading to speculation that David Radford may have made good on his vow to kill her - although the gangster isn't the only one with a vested interest in ensuring her silence. Smithy eventually discovers the wayward PC by her father's hospital bed and declares his love - but their chances of romance are cut cruelly short when she is struck by a sniper's bullet while returning to Sun Hill station with earth-shattering news.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Part two of two. After Kerry tragically loses her fight for life, Gabriel sets about covering his tracks by disposing of forensic evidence and intimidating a witness - but a shocking revelation could shatter his cold-blooded demeanour. Stunned by Kerry's death, a grief-crazed Smithy lashes out at Adam, swears revenge on David Radford and hands in his resignation to Gina, while DI Morrell resolves to track down the real culprit.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Already grief-stricken over Kerry's death, Yvonne faces further trauma as her sister Beverley is roughed up and Shirley reappears in Sun Hill, bringing serious trouble in her wake. Andrea fears her true identity is about to be exposed when her editor is brought in for questioning, while Samantha puzzles over a cryptic message she believes was left by Abi's abductor.

programme.title: Hetty Wainthropp Investigates
programme.desc: Hetty investigates the apparent suicide of Robert's uncle, found hanged at his home, and discovers the whole village where he lived is gripped by superstition. Hetty begins to suspect that the villagers of Readsby - once a notorious haven for witches - are still engaged in satanic practices, and is determined to prove that they were somehow involved.

programme.title: Hetty Wainthropp Investigates
programme.desc: The elderly sleuth makes a determined effort to drum up more business, and is hired to find a woman's missing son - a schizophrenic released into the community. She faces a race against time to track down the troubled youngster before he decides there's no point in going on. Detective drama, starring Patricia Routledge.

programme.title: Lorna Doone
programme.desc: Lavish adaptation of RD Blackmore's novel of lovers, outlaws and warring families in 17th-century Exmoor. Amelia Warner stars as the eponymous heroine, with Queer as Folk's Aidan Gillen as her evil aristocratic cousin, who wants her for himself at any cost. The cast also includes Richard Coyle, Martin Clunes, Barbara Flynn and Michael Kitchen.

programme.title: Lorna Doone
programme.desc: Lavish adaptation of RD Blackmore's novel of lovers, outlaws and warring families in 17th-century Exmoor. Amelia Warner stars as the eponymous heroine, with Queer as Folk's Aidan Gillen as her evil aristocratic cousin, who wants her for himself at any cost. The cast also includes Richard Coyle, Martin Clunes, Barbara Flynn and Michael Kitchen.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Sister Julienne receives an SOS from Holloway Prison, whose usual maternity workers have been struck down by illness, and when she and Trixie step in to help, the nun puts her reputation on the line to prevent a heavily pregnant convict having her unborn baby taken away by social services. Shelagh faces heartache when a routine pregnancy check reveals something far more serious, Alec has a confession for Jenny, and Fred takes the gang to the theatre to celebrate Chummy's birthday - only for the trip to end in disaster. Lacey Turner, best known as EastEnders' Stacey Branning, guest stars.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Jenny has an eventful few days, starting with a patient who as well as having herself to worry about, is also struggling to cope with her mother, an agoraphobic who hasn't been outside for at least 12 years. On top of that, Alec asks the midwife to accompany him to Brighton for the weekend, leaving her wondering if his intentions are strictly honourable. However, things soon take a tragic turn. Meanwhile, Shelagh joins the local choir to take her mind off her problems. Jessica Raine, Leo Staar and Laura Main star.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: Jack examines a case previously undertaken by a deceased colleague, who was convinced that the alleged suicide of a journalist was a cover-up by the American government. Enlisting the help of a UFO-spotter, the team discovers the reporter witnessed a mysterious air crash near a US Air Force base, and the retired officers try to track down the original personnel to get some answers. Guest starring Mark Williams, Glynis Barber, Michael Brandon and Raquel Cassidy, with Amanda Redman.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: A woman is murdered and the forensic evidence takes the team to a cosmetic clinic where the victim had been receiving various treatments seemingly for free, but Nikki and Silva are frustrated by the CEO of Hamilton Ashe hospital when he blocks access to Karen's medical records. Meanwhile, when his daughter Rosie turns up at the Lyell as her mum is in hospital over a pregnancy complication, Thomas must play the doting father for a few weeks - a role that does not come naturally.

programme.title: Waking the Dead
programme.desc: Trevor Eve and Sue Johnston star in the first of a two-part story. A woman who went missing from a care home in 1986 is found brutally murdered in a burnt-out car, and the team discovers she had recently abducted a teenage girl herself. As the investigation continues, both cases appear to be linked to an urban myth about a character known as the Bag Man - an eyeless villain who kidnaps children. With Eva Birthistle, Tara FitzGerald and Wil Johnson.

programme.title: Wallander
programme.desc: Two bodies are discovered on a life raft in Ystad harbour, the victims having been shot through the head and had their tongues burnt off with acid. The heavily tattooed corpses reveal links to the Russian mob and are instrumental in proving the men originated from Latvia, so Major Karlis Liepa, an officer with the country's police department, is sent to work with Wallander. But an anonymous phone call, a shooting and a break-in at the police HQ soon convince Wallander of a leak in the investigation - and he immediately suspects Liepa. Guest starring Soren Malling (The Killing), with Kenneth Branagh as the world-weary detective.

credits.actor: Kenneth Branagh as the world-weary detective

programme.title: Garden Hopping
programme.desc: Daphne Ledward visits the stunning Rowden Gardens on Dartmoor - one of the participants in the National Gardens Scheme.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Bramwell
programme.desc: Eleanor opens her new infirmary for the poor, but also agrees to help in her father's private practice. Period drama, starring Jemma Redgrave.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: The lads reach South Africa where they help complete the building of a medical centre, leading to romance for Jeremy, who falls for one of the nurses. Meanwhile, Andy Butcher lands himself in deep trouble after a kind-hearted gesture to help a destitute local family leads to accusations of ivory-poaching.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Yvonne is horrified to learn Beverley was assaulted by her own husband and promptly alerts CID, only for the case to take an unexpected twist when the culprit insists he acted in self-defence. Jim puts his marriage on the line by succumbing to his gambling addiction yet again, despite a stern lecture from June and threats from an angry loan shark. Jack returns to Sun Hill, determined to reassert his status as top cop, but his colleagues doubt whether he has fully recovered from his heart attack.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Donna urges Jess to stop pining for Zubin and get on with her life - and new anaesthetist Sean might be just the tonic she needs. Connie and Will bury the hatchet, and Owen discovers Diane is still taking contraceptive pills despite claiming she wants a baby. As Tricia undergoes her first radiotherapy session, Chrissie finds a lump in her own breast and makes an urgent appointment to get it checked out. Samantha Beckinsale guest stars.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Jude and Matt face an awkward time at work after their one-night stand and Kate returns to the hospital following Trevor's death. Meanwhile, a single mother who is smuggling drugs in her stomach arrives for treatment after being dragged from the river bound and gagged. Lisa Coleman, Jason Merrells and Sorcha Cusack star.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Tough former Met officer PC Roger Valentine joins the team and immediately makes a good impression by cracking down on muggings in the Sun Hill area - but his old-fashioned attitude toward homosexuality threatens to ruffle a few feathers when he's partnered with Lance. Jim continues to struggle with his gambling addiction and chilling CCTV footage of Abi makes Samantha fear for her daughter's safety.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: On Mother's Day, Etta is concerned about Lloyd's friends, while Sharon worries about the decrease in takings at the pub.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Ignoring his family's advice, Lloyd goes looking for adventure.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: The group draw lots to decide who will get to have Christmas Day off duty, and Josie and Bayleaf spend the night together. Starring James Hazeldine and Katharine Rogers.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: The roguish antiques dealer gets involved in a con at a country house involving the sale of a fake painting in exchange for a parcel of diamonds. However, Lovejoy later realises he too has been set up over the deal. Richard Griffiths guest stars, with Ian McShane.

programme.title: Bergerac
programme.desc: A recently paroled convict takes his son to Jersey without telling the boy's mother or his parole officer. Detective drama, starring John Nettles.

programme.title: Bread
programme.desc: Adrian, who has been writing his memoirs, makes a decision that will change his life. Joey has reached the end of his tether.

programme.title: Are You Being Served?
programme.desc: Old Mr Grace recognises a photo of Mr Humphries' mother and begins to suspect the head of menswear may be his son and heir. John Inman stars.

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Jean is concerned for Lionel's success as the day of his book launch arrives and wonders if Alistair will be able to help out with a publicity stunt should sales start to flag. Romantic comedy, starring Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: Yours Truly - If You're Not Careful
programme.desc: Billy and Alvin learn that Truly's ex-wife is trying to find him, and waste no time in gleefully tormenting their pal with the news of a strange woman's appearance in town. Long-running comedy, starring Peter Sallis and Frank Thornton.

programme.title: Inspector George Gently
programme.desc: The chief inspector comes up against Rattigan, an old adversary from his days in London, whose legal challenge to his prison sentence has been upheld on the grounds that Gently fabricated evidence against him. Donald McGhee, the detective's friend and former colleague in the Met, unexpectedly arrives in Durham to offer support, but his motives remain questionable. With Bacchus torn between loyalty and ambition, Gently knows that it's up to him to find a solution to his dilemma. Sixties-set detective drama, starring Martin Shaw and Lee Ingleby, with Kevin Whately, Diana Quick, Nigel Lindsay, Morgan Watkins and Ralph Brown.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: Part one of two. Gerry is spooked by the discovery of UCOS's latest victim - a cop, whose body has lain untouched under a basement for 30 years. As accusations of police corruption and underhand dealings begin to surface, Gerry has to face up to some skeletons in his own closet and it's a race against time for the team to help before his murky past catches up with him. While babysitting his grandson, Gerry becomes convinced that only he holds the key to the investigation and goes Awol to uncover the truth. Starring Dennis Waterman and Denis Lawson.

programme.title: Taggart
programme.desc: The detective and sidekick Jardine investigate when a prominent loan shark dies after being brutally attacked with an axe. Jardine starts a relationship with an actress who is playing Lizzie Borden in the studio that owns the apparent murder weapon as the duo come to believe it may be a revenge killing - and that there could be a link with Glasgow's Garden Festival. Celia Imrie guest stars, with Mark McManus and James Macpherson.

programme.title: The House of Eliott
programme.desc: Beatrice considers her future with Jack and leaves Evie dumbfounded by accepting Larry Cotter's proposal to join forces and venture into ready-to-wear.

programme.title: Garden Hopping
programme.desc: Daphne Ledward visits the Old Mill Herbary at Bodmin, Cornwall, where a wide range of herbs and medicinal plants are cultivated.

programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Bramwell
programme.desc: Eleanor and Nurse Carr carry out tuberculosis tests in the East End slums, while Robert's electro-therapy treatment causes problems. Period drama, starring Jemma Redgrave.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: The soldiers help to rescue hostages in the African state of Mokindi. Meanwhile, Sadie and Paul are reunited. Starring Robson Green and Duncan Bell.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Tough former Met officer PC Roger Valentine joins the team and immediately makes a good impression by cracking down on muggings in the Sun Hill area - but his old-fashioned attitude toward homosexuality threatens to ruffle a few feathers when he's partnered with Lance. Jim continues to struggle with his gambling addiction and chilling CCTV footage of Abi makes Samantha fear for her daughter's safety.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Rosie is injured while chasing a thief out of the hospital, and undergoes an emergency operation - which leads to a startling revelation. Tricia faces her first day of chemotherapy and receives a grovelling apology from Carlos, who reveals he left her because he couldn't cope with her illness. Lisa is given the job of clinical matron on a trial basis, and Owen chooses Donna's birthday party as the perfect moment to publicly accept Diane's marriage proposal.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: A cleric attacks the driver whose car hit his sister and niece while he was drunk at the wheel, and a six-year-old girl is injured running into a greenhouse. Jude tries to tell Matt she is pregnant, but changes her mind after learning he has been asked to run a bar in Crete.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Kerry Young's funeral casts a sombre shadow over Sun Hill as the team gather to pay their last respects to their colleague, but any hopes of a dignified send-off are dashed by an emotional outburst from Gabriel. Debt-ridden Jim fears an investigation into illegal goings-on at the greyhound track will expose his own complicity, while the close professional relationship between Jack and Debbie turns personal.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: When a builder's estimate makes Frank see red, he decides to attempt some DIY.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Pat is shocked when she finds out that Mandy has being lying to her.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: Drama series following the lives of the heroic Blue Watch at Blackwall fire station..

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: Jane helps the roguish antiques dealer search for a valuable Yeats painting in Ireland, until a more important matter captures their attention. Ian McShane stars.

programme.title: Bergerac
programme.desc: A private meeting of European financiers attracts the attention of three criminals, who break into the venue to rob the delegates. Detective drama, guest starring Patrick Allen, with John Nettles and Terrence Alexander.

programme.title: Bread
programme.desc: Leonora announces she is pregnant, Lilo Lil brings Nellie news of Freddie's whereabouts, and Grandad dreams about his funeral. Last-ever episode of Carla Lane's sitcom.

programme.title: Are You Being Served?
programme.desc: Miss Brahms becomes the store spokesperson when Grace Brothers tries out closed-circuit advertising. Comedy, with Wendy Richard, Mollie Sugden and John Inman.

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Jean and Lionel at last fulfil their dream and take a romantic trip to Paris - but it seems they are not alone. Bob Larbey's comedy about late-blossoming love, starring Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Clegg, Truly, Alvin and Billy encounter a stranger who is determined to travel by canal to Ilkley in an inflatable swan. However, when punctures disrupt the man's dream, Entwistle is on hand to ensure the voyage goes to plan. Tommy Cannon and Bobby Ball guest star.

programme.title: Inspector George Gently
programme.desc: It's 1969 and six months since the shootings in Durham Cathedral, and while Gently is almost back to full fitness, Bacchus has lost his confidence and tenders his resignation. Gently is determined to help his sergeant, so he gets him involved in one last case, the death in custody of a man arrested during a street protest - an investigation that leaves both detectives questioning what it means to be a police officer at a time when attitudes to the force are changing. Martin Shaw and Lee Ingleby star, with Lisa McGrillis, Steve Evets and Ruth Gemmell.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: Part two of two. Danny takes Gerry on the run as they search for the proof they need to prove his innocence - despite Gerry remaining tight-lipped about his involvement with dodgy dealings in his old unit. The stakes are high as the Unsolved Crime and Open Case Squad goes after one of the biggest crime families in London, and it's those closest to Gerry who are dangerously put in the firing line. Starring Dennis Waterman, Nicholas Lyndhurst, Tamzin Outhwaite and Denis Lawson.

programme.title: Taggart
programme.desc: The body of a woman is discovered in woodland and all evidence points to suicide, but Taggart's suspicions are shared by the victim's sister who thinks her brother-in-law is responsible. Detective drama, starring Mark McManus.

programme.title: The House of Eliott
programme.desc: Beatrice receives news that will change her life for ever, while Evie is introduced to impoverished painter Daniel Page.

programme.title: The House of Eliott
programme.desc: The birth of Tilly's baby brings excitement to the workshop, but Beatrice is still concerned about her own future. Evie accuses Daniel of betraying her trust.

programme.title: Bramwell
programme.desc: Eleanor and Nurse Carr carry out tuberculosis tests in the East End slums, while Robert's electro-therapy treatment causes problems. Period drama, starring Jemma Redgrave.

programme.title: Bramwell
programme.desc: Eleanor is flattered by the attentions of charming Dr Hunter _ but when his housekeeper dies suddenly, she changes her opinion. Period drama, starring Jemma Redgrave.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: The officers find themselves stuck in Kenya's Makindi province, struggling to find a safe pick up point. Meanwhile, Dave and Donna are unsure about their future together.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Kerry Young's funeral casts a sombre shadow over Sun Hill as the team gather to pay their last respects to their colleague, but any hopes of a dignified send-off are dashed by an emotional outburst from Gabriel. Debt-ridden Jim fears an investigation into illegal goings-on at the greyhound track will expose his own complicity, while the close professional relationship between Jack and Debbie turns personal.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Rosie is upset to discover that Mubbs has been discussing his feelings about the baby with Connie, but that's nothing to the humiliation of finding out they slept together. Lisa passes her trial as clinical matron and breaks the news of Owen and Diane's engagement to a philosophical Chrissie. An exhausted Tricia struggles to cope on her first day back at work after undergoing chemotherapy and ends up going home early.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: A stroke victim brought in for respite care suffers another attack and falls downstairs. At the staff Christmas party, Jude stuns Matt by revealing she is pregnant, while Kate's brave facade begins to crumble. Hospital drama, starring Lisa Coleman and Jason Merrells.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Debbie is assigned a major drugs investigation - much to Phil's irritation and Jim's alarm - but the chance to prove herself takes second place to family concerns when she learns her son has sustained internal bleeding from his fall. The bad news prompts her to hand in her resignation, leaving Jack wondering what the future holds for their relationship. Andrea tells Smithy that Gabriel raped Kerry, whose death continues to take its toll on the renegade copper.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Arthur is full of the joys of Spring and tries to make Pat see the brighter side of life. Grant has an idea to help improve takings and Sharon gets a visit from a brewery rep.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: As Easter approaches, Dot wants to share her news, Gill's plans unsettle Mark, and Pete believes he has the answer to Arthur's problems.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: Drama series following the lives of the heroic Blue Watch at Blackwall fire station..

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: Charlie Gimbert plots revenge, while Lovejoy and Lady Jane bicker over a royal dinner service belonging to a Belgian countess. Light-hearted drama, starring Ian McShane and Phyllis Logan.

programme.title: Bergerac
programme.desc: Jim wonders why he's been assigned to protect a distinguished journalist, unaware a gang of African thugs are waiting in the wings to cause mayhem. John Nettles and Barry Foster star.

programme.title: Bread
programme.desc: Billy wastes money on a stolen statue and Joey tries to claim an incontinence allowance for Grandad. First episode of Carla Lane's comedy, with Jean Boht and Peter Howitt.

programme.title: Are You Being Served?
programme.sub-title: The Erotic Dreams of Mrs Slocombe
programme.desc: In the unlikeliest love match of all time, Mrs Slocombe woos confirmed bachelor Mr Humphries in a bid to make all her romantic dreams come true. Mollie Sugden and John Inman star.

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Jean is bridesmaid at the wedding of Lionel's father, but nobody is sure who is giving the bride away. Comedy, starring Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Clegg climbs a tree to prove a point, but finds getting down is not as easy. Meanwhile, the police investigate the case of a runaway cooker. Comedy, starring Peter Sallis.

programme.title: Inspector George Gently
programme.desc: A young woman's body is washed up beside a pier, leading Gently and Bacchus to question the staff and guests of the nearby holiday camp where she worked. It turns out she was a popular member of staff, a charismatic performer and great with the guests - but her mother's reaction to her death makes the detectives suspect there is more to her family situation than meets the eye. And when her colleagues' alibis for the night of the murder don't quite stack up, a different picture of the victim - and the camp - comes to light. Martin Shaw and Lee Ingleby star, with guest appearances from Pixie Lott, Lee Boardman, Lisa Riley and Andrea Lowe.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: Danny and Steve 'welcome' new boss Ted Case into the UCOS office in Sasha's absence, but for all his experience, keen eye for detail and a killer instinct for detecting liars, they aren't as sold on his superstitious quirks. While trying to work one another out, the team treads carefully in the case of a murdered vicar who received racist hate mail in the lead up to his death. With emotions running high, it's up to Ted to pull together his new unit and keep the peace in one of UCOS's most sensitive cases. Starring Larry Lamb, Denis Lawson and Nicholas Lyndhurst.

programme.title: Taggart
programme.desc: A social worker is murdered and a key suspect goes missing in this feature-length instalment. The chance discovery of a cache of explosives plunges Jim headlong into a multiple murder investigation and as the death toll mounts, he finds his hardest job is establishing a motive - there may be an Irish connection, or a sinister criminal mastermind could possibly be responsible. Mark McManus stars as the Caledonian copper, with James Macpherson, Iain Anders and Robert Robertson.

programme.title: The House of Eliott
programme.desc: Beatrice's baby is born prematurely, taking everyone by surprise, and Evie longs for the chance to see Daniel again.

programme.title: Garden Hopping
programme.desc: Daphne Ledward visits the Old Mill Herbary at Bodmin, Cornwall, where a wide range of herbs and medicinal plants are cultivated.

programme.desc: A young Idris Elba puts in an appearance at the Thrift Infirmary, as Lady Cora's pregnant maid is rushed in with labour pains, causing Robert's reluctant return..

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Jeremy announces he is planning to marry his girlfriend, but is surprised at his friends' response. Meanwhile, Cate Hobbs receives bad news.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Debbie is assigned a major drugs investigation - much to Phil's irritation and Jim's alarm - but the chance to prove herself takes second place to family concerns when she learns her son has sustained internal bleeding from his fall. The bad news prompts her to hand in her resignation, leaving Jack wondering what the future holds for their relationship. Andrea tells Smithy that Gabriel raped Kerry, whose death continues to take its toll on the renegade copper.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Jess thinks she has contracted a sexually transmitted infection from Sean and gets herself tested. Mubbs' messy personal life causes him to make a serious professional mistake and he blames Connie for his predicament, threatening to tell her husband about their affair. Tricia gets good news about her health, while her friend and fellow cancer patient Maggie is readmitted to the hospital.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Vigilantes take on a known child sex offender, resulting in two injuries. Jack attempts to save the life and unborn child of a heart attack victim, Jude decides to have an abortion and Gloria discovers that Richard has multiple sclerosis.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Kerry's father visits Sun Hill to collect his murdered daughter's belongings, reopening old wounds for Smithy who begins to see Gabriel for the manipulative psychopath he is and threatens to officially accuse him of rape. Elsewhere, Gary thinks he's stumbled across a dismembered body - until Suzie points out the grisly remains are actually a collection of prosthetic limbs.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: The Miss Queen Vic beauty contest takes a surprising turn.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: The world of glitz and glamour is beckoning Sam - but will husband Ricky allow it? The Taverniers await an important decision on Lloyd's future, and Dot has a bee in her bonnet.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: Part one of two. The Blue Watch boys brave the flames to save more lives in a special festive edition of the drama.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: An aristocrat who has fallen on difficult times seeks the roguish dealer's help in redeeming a valuable antique he has pawned. Light-hearted drama, guest starring Jack Shepherd, with Ian McShane.

programme.title: Bergerac
programme.desc: Jim investigates the disappearance of a film star's wife and the mysterious death of a scuba diver - then begins to suspect the missing woman's callous husband is responsible for both. John Nettles stars.

programme.title: Bread
programme.desc: Billy buys a ring for wife Julie. However, he learns that opals are symbolic of bad fortune and determines to get rid of it. Comedy, starring Nick Conway and Caroline Milmoe.

programme.title: Are You Being Served?
programme.desc: Mrs Slocombe invents a perfume with aphrodisiac qualities which brings the staff out of their shells. After a misunderstanding, Mrs Peacock finds her husband without his pants, which are in the hands of Mr Rumbold's secretary. Vintage comedy, with Mollie Sugden, Frank Thornton and Nicholas Smith.

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Middle-aged romantics Jean and Lionel finally decide to move in together, but fall out over incidental details - such as whose house they are going to live in. Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer star.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: Has Anyone Seen a Peruvian Wart?
programme.desc: Roy Barraclough guest stars as Crowcroft, a well-known Lothario with a preference for gullible women. When he samples Nora Batty's baking, he decides to make her his next target. Long-running comedy, with Kathy Staff, Peter Sallis and Frank Thornton.

programme.title: Inspector George Gently
programme.desc: A murder at a Turkish baths seems like an open-and-shut case, as witnesses put an ex-serviceman at the scene of the crime and the suspect has left his ID in a locker. But as Gently and Bacchus begin their search for the man, things soon become complicated. His psychiatrist reveals he was showing signs of schizophrenia, while his brother claims he was far too soft to have killed a man - and when a second body turns up, the duo are led into a world of medical secrets at an Army testing facility. Crime drama, starring Martin Shaw and Lee Ingleby, with William Ash and Jemma Redgrave.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: Ted leads an investigation into the apparent suicide of a city trader who was embroiled in the cut-throat world of London's financial district in the 1980s. As the team delve deeper into the macho fraternity of 'The Wolfpack', they find a darker side to the debauchery, secret hand signals and all-nighters that bonded the traders together - including a strict hierarchy that might be worth killing for. Meanwhile, Steve tries to learn some tricks of the trade, amid his own financial crisis. Detective drama, starring Larry Lamb.

programme.title: Taggart
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. The body of a murder victim who was killed with an axe is dredged from the bottom of the Clyde. The discovery sparks an investigation which takes Jim and his officers away from the mean streets of Glasgow into the scenic Scottish Highlands. Police drama, starring Mark McManus and James MacPherson, and guest starring Peter Mullan.

programme.title: The House of Eliott
programme.desc: Beatrice recommends Daniel's artistic skills to an attractive client, prompting Evie to question her judgement - and the ensuing argument blinds them to Grace's frustration and the suspicious developments at the Bayswater workshop.

programme.title: The House of Eliott
programme.desc: Joseph makes a shocking discovery, abruptly ending the sisters' excitement about the new clothing deal.

programme.desc: A young Idris Elba puts in an appearance at the Thrift Infirmary, as Lady Cora's pregnant maid is rushed in with labour pains, causing Robert's reluctant return..

programme.title: Bramwell
programme.desc: Eleanor comes up against the governors of the East London Hospital when they threaten to take over the Thrift. Period drama, starring Jemma Redgrave.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Lilian receives a visitor from beyond the grave while honeymooning with Jeremy, while Deborah's dalliance with drugs leads to her spending the eve of her wedding in prison. A truck carrying men and weapons to Aldershot is ambushed by hooded mercenaries and Chris' intervention leads to him being shot and taken hostage.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Kerry's father visits Sun Hill to collect his murdered daughter's belongings, reopening old wounds for Smithy who begins to see Gabriel for the manipulative psychopath he is and threatens to officially accuse him of rape. Elsewhere, Gary thinks he's stumbled across a dismembered body - until Suzie points out the grisly remains are actually a collection of prosthetic limbs.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: The festive spirit takes hold at Holby as the Christmas party gets into full swing. Connie dresses up as a sexy Santa, with Will as her elf, while Mubbs and Rosie make up - but not for long, thanks to a drunken Chrissie. Sean tells Jess he wants to be with her after guessing she is pregnant, and cancer patient Maggie is told the devastating news she has only weeks to live.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: A child is airlifted to Holby after almost drowning, Baz is traumatised when she has to take a blood sample from her own baby, while a suspected meninigitis case causes concern.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Wayne Radford's grave is vandalised and the prime suspect is promptly gunned down, leading Gina to uncover the shocking truth about Irene. Smithy plays a dangerous double game, trying to worm his way into Gabriel's confidence, while simultaneously urging Andrea to spill the beans about the psychotic copper's rape of Kerry - but the undercover reporter soon has other things on her mind when Phil catches her in a passionate embrace with Neil.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Frank and Pat move out of the B&B and Arthur practices his interviewing technique.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Sam has a secret appointment, and keeps her family in the dark - but is she getting out of her depth?.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: Part two of two. The Blue Watch boys brave the flames to save more lives in a special festive edition of the drama.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: Tinker lectures Lovejoy on the importance of not abusing his ability to gather ill-gotten gains. However, the antiques dealer briefly turns his back on his own ethical standards, only to soon regret his transgression. Ian McShane and Dudley Sutton star.

programme.title: Bergerac
programme.desc: Jim investigates links between a sinister coven and a man apparently frightened to death by his dreams. Charles Gray guest stars, with Jill Meager, John Nettles and Terence Alexander.

programme.title: Bread
programme.desc: Freddie Boswell makes a return to the family home after being shunned by his mistress. Unsurprisingly, he gets a cool reception from his wife and children.

programme.title: Are You Being Served?
programme.desc: Mr Humphries is accused of dipping his hand in the till. His distinguished career appears to end in disgrace when he is dismissed after being found guilty. Comedy, with John Inman and Mollie Sugden.

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Jean falls out with Lionel, but tries to pretend everything is fine when her sister-in-law Penny and husband Stephen pay a visit. Comedy, starring Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Clegg's decision to write his memoirs causes Howard a great deal of concern, while Smiler is devastated when a blossoming relationship ends suddenly. Long-running comedy series, starring Peter Sallis, Robert Fyfe and Stephen Lewis.

programme.title: Inspector George Gently
programme.desc: Bacchus and Gently are called in to investigate the death of a miner, which is being treated as suspicious because even though his body was discovered down the pit, records show he was above ground when he disappeared. Alleged victim Arthur Hawkes was a proud union man, and his children confirm he fought long and hard to keep the closure-threatened mine open. But as the detectives dig deeper, they find that not everyone agrees with this portrait of him. Could he really have sold his union comrades down the river? Martin Shaw and Lee Ingleby star, with Simon Greenall, Jack Deam and Michael Socha.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: With Sasha back on fighting form, UCOS investigates the death of a talented cricket prodigy, who was the apple of his father's eye, yet loathed by his on-field team-mates. The death was recorded as misadventure but with new evidence pointing to infighting, over-zealous autograph hunters and extra marital affairs, UCOS are soon bowled over by the list of potential murder suspects. Meanwhile, wise to Steve's monetary problems, Danny appoints himself as his personal financial adviser. Detective drama, starring Larry Lamb.

programme.title: Taggart
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Jim investigates the murders of a Glasgow by-election candidate and her agent, who had been championing the return of capital punishment. However, the veteran detective finds himself hard-pressed to arrive at a quick solution to the crime. Elsewhere, a young woman is strangled by her stalker then raped. Robert Carlyle makes one of his earliest screen appearances, alongside star Mark McManusrs.

programme.title: The House of Eliott
programme.desc: Legal action against Larry Cotter proves fruitless, so the sisters decide to take matters into their own hands.

programme.title: Bramwell
programme.desc: Eleanor comes up against the governors of the East London Hospital when they threaten to take over the Thrift. Period drama, starring Jemma Redgrave.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.desc: The panel members debate more of the big issues the whole country is talking about.

programme.title: Super 4
programme.desc: Animated comedy adventure series featuring a gang of heroes who protect the city of Technopolis and its King Kenric against evil elements.

programme.title: Thunderbirds Are Go
programme.desc: Kayo, with the help of a futuristic game creator that only talks like a wizard, must play through a futuristic holo-game called Cavern Quest to stop the Chaos Crew from stealing a powerful piece of technology.

programme.title: Dare Master
programme.desc: Danny takes on a BMX champion at the UK's national cycling centre. Can he win the race or will he get the cream pie forfeit?.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: Madcap slapstick and mayhem as the celebrated cat and mouse plot against each other.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: Madcap slapstick and mayhem as the celebrated cat and mouse plot against each other.

programme.title: Scrambled!
programme.desc: Two hours of children's fun and entertainment.

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Fizz and Weasel plan to enter Fizz's new condiment in a culinary contest. Magoo mistakes them for members of his band ready for a reunion..

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr. Bean disguises himself as a Pensioner in order to avoid lunch with Irma and her mum..

programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud
programme.desc: George finds a computer called Val but Val has a mind of her own. Soon she's set about uploading embarrassing videos to social media..

programme.title: Thunderbirds Are Go
programme.desc: While the members of International Rescue attend a prestigious global airshow, a test pilot unveils an ultra-fast superjet.

programme.title: Craig of the Creek
programme.desc: Craig of the Creek follows a young boy and his two friends as they go on adventures in a world of untamed, kid-dominated wilderness in the creek.

programme.title: James Martin's Saturday Morning
programme.desc: James is joined by guests Kate Thornton and Lucy Alexander, and chefs Claude Bosi and Shaun Hill. With contributions from wine expert Oz Clarke and truffle hunter Zac Frost.

programme.title: John and Lisa's Weekend Kitchen
programme.desc: With Christmas behind them, John Torode and Lisa Faulkner present some light and fresh recipes to kick off the new year. They start with home-made granola and stewed fruit, Lisa makes a one-pot vegetarian pasta dish and a spiced cod tray bake and John demonstrates pearl barley with an array of mushrooms.

programme.title: Nadia's Family Feasts
programme.desc: Nadia Sawalha is joined by chef Eran Tibi to dish up a family feast from the Middle East. The menu comprises an Israeli mezze of stuffed brick and sweet potato hummus for breakfast, mussakhan for lunch, Eran's aubergine, tomato and beef stew for dinner and Nadia's cigar baklava with cheat's pistachio ice cream for dessert.

programme.title: The Masked Singer
programme.desc: Another six unknown celebrities battle it out in the singing contest that has taken other countries by storm. The mystery contestants are dressed head to toe in elaborate costumes designed to hide their identities, while the panel - Jonathan Ross, Davina McCall, Rita Ora and Ken Jeong - tries to guess who they are. By the end of the show, the second celebrity's identity will be revealed and they will be waving goodbye to the show. Joel Dommett hosts the proceedings.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Warwick Davis in which a team of family and friends answers questions about top 10 lists from the realms of pop culture and general knowledge, then tries to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money.

programme.title: The Brits Are Coming
programme.desc: Alice Levine announces the 2020 Brit Award nominees. With performances by some of 2019's biggest acts, including Liam Payne, Mabel, Aitch, Freya Ridings and Dermot Kennedy.

programme.title: Catchphrase
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts the game show, asking Strictly head judge Shirley Ballas, actress Bhavna Limbachia and This Morning's resident GP Dr Ranj Singh to 'see it and say it' as they try to guess the familiar phrases hidden in animated clues. The players battle to reach the Super Catchphrase round, where one of them could win 50,000 for their chosen charities.

programme.title: The Masked Singer
programme.desc: Five mystery celebrities battle it out in the singing contest that has taken other countries by storm. The contestants are dressed head to toe in elaborate costumes - Chameleon, Duck, Hedgehog, Queen Bee and Unicorn - designed to hide their identities, while the panel - Jonathan Ross, Davina McCall, Rita Ora and Ken Jeong - tries to guess who they are. By the end of the show, the third celebrity's identity will be revealed and they will be waving goodbye to the show. Joel Dommett hosts the proceedings.

programme.title: The Voice UK
programme.desc: Emma Willis hosts the latest round of the blind auditions in the spinning-chair singing contest, in which celebrity 'coaches' seek out the nation's best vocal talent. But there is a simple twist - with the four coaches selecting their teams through 'blind auditions', looks play no part in the selection process, meaning each singer is chosen on vocal ability alone. Meghan Trainor is the newest recruit to the judging panel, joining series regulars Olly Murs, Tom Jones and Will.i.am.

programme.title: Shopping with Keith Lemon
programme.desc: Keith goes rug shopping with antiques legend David Dickinson and visits an Asian supermarket with singer Lily Allen, while also talking about their life and career.

programme.title: Fast & Furious 7 (2015)
programme.desc: After defeating Owen Shaw and his crew and securing amnesty for their past crimes, Dom, Brian and the rest of the team return home to live normal lives again. However Shaw's older brother Deckard - a rogue special forces assassin vows revenge on Dom, who he holds responsible for leaving Owen in a coma. Action thriller sequel, starring Vin Diesel, Jason Statham and Paul Walker in his last film role.

programme.title: Thunderbirds Are Go
programme.desc: The Tracy brothers and their friends at International Rescue set out to foil the nefarious plots of the evil Hood. An updated remake of the classic 1960s marionette adventure series, this time featuring computer-animated characters on live-action modeled sets. With the voices of Rosamund Pike, Kayvan Novak and Thomas Brodie-Sangster, with the original Parker - David Graham - returning to voice Lady Penelope's long-serving chauffeur.

programme.title: Dare Master
programme.desc: Danny goes extreme window cleaning, but will he be brave enough to abseil down the building and avoid the forfeit?.

programme.title: Scrambled!
