programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Magoo thinks he's on a trip to Translovenia and takes shelter in a mansion owned by a vampire. In reality, this vampire is just Weasel..

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr. Bean climbs into his favourite tree to stop it from being chopped down..

programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud
programme.desc: Fuzzypeg eats the Spuds' fish supper and Dave has to catch another. Things look up when he hooks something, but it turns out to be a whale.

programme.title: Kung Fu Panda: The Paws of Destiny
programme.desc: The four students get too confident with their new and untested skills, and sneak off without permission..

programme.title: Craig of the Creek
programme.desc: Craig of the Creek follows a young boy and his two friends as they go on adventures in a world of untamed, kid-dominated wilderness in the creek.

programme.title: Ainsley's Caribbean Kitchen
programme.desc: Ainsley Harriott takes a culinary tour of the Caribbean, visiting the islands that have inspired his cooking. His first stop is Jamaica, where his father grew up. He visits the island's famous Coronation Market and a Rastafarian farm-to-table restaurant, where he learns to make ackee-stuffed ravioli. He also takes a trip to the villa where Ian Fleming created James Bond.

programme.title: Living on the Veg
programme.desc: Vegetarian food ideas, presented by Henry Firth and Ian Theasby. First on the menu are Sunday roast, vegan cheese in a toasted sandwich, sticky toffee pudding and snack ideas using avocados. The hosts are joined by actress Sadie Frost, who tries their jalfrezi curry.

programme.title: Gino's Italian Escape
programme.desc: Gino D'Acampo's latest leg begins in the Italian fashion capital of Milan, where he visits an elegant cocktail bar who were the first to introduce the idea of the aperitivo in the city. Its train station is one of the busiest in Europe and it's from here he travels on to the town of Treviglio, the home of Bianchi bikes - the first mass-manufactured bicycle in the world. Gino gets a tour of the factory before test riding one of their latest electric bikes alongside a group of local cyclists. Moving on, he visits the medieval town of Bergamo, where he meets ice-cream maker Niccolo, and visits a co-operative restaurant.

programme.title: The Greek Islands with Julia Bradbury
programme.desc: Julia visits the picturesque island of Crete, intending to step away from the tourist trail and head deep into its heart to explore the Dikti mountains and its striking plateau of windmills. She meets goat shepherd Giannis, who shows her how he makes cheese using traditional methods. Back on the coast at Rethymno, Julia tries the delicacy baklava, meeting filo pastry expert Giorgos, and also meets master artisan Nico, who expertly makes stringed musical instrument the Cretan lyra. Her journey ends on the stunning but poignant neighbouring island of Spinalonga - once an exiled leper colony.

programme.title: The Voice UK
programme.desc: Emma Willis hosts the latest round of the blind auditions in the spinning-chair singing contest, in which celebrity 'coaches' seek out the nation's best vocal talent. But there is a simple twist - with the four coaches selecting their teams through 'blind auditions', looks play no part in the selection process, meaning each singer is chosen on vocal ability alone. Meghan Trainor is the newest recruit to the judging panel, joining series regulars Olly Murs, Tom Jones and Will.i.am.

programme.title: The Masked Singer
programme.desc: Five mystery celebrities battle it out in the singing contest that has taken other countries by storm. The contestants are dressed head to toe in elaborate costumes - Chameleon, Duck, Hedgehog, Queen Bee and Unicorn - designed to hide their identities, while the panel - Jonathan Ross, Davina McCall, Rita Ora and Ken Jeong - tries to guess who they are. By the end of the show, the third celebrity's identity will be revealed and they will be waving goodbye to the show. Joel Dommett hosts the proceedings.

programme.title: Minions (2015)
programme.desc: A race of strange, babbling yellow creatures has served the cause of evil throughout the history of the world. In the 1960s, three of these eternal henchmen get a job working for a criminal genius who is hatching a plot against the British crown - but while carrying out her orders, they uncover a threat to their whole species. Animated comedy, with the voices of Sandra Bullock, Pierre Coffin, Jon Hamm and Michael Keaton.

programme.title: Dancing on Ice
programme.desc: Phillip Schofield and Holly Willoughby host the celebrity skating challenge, joined by judges Christopher Dean, Jayne Torvill, Ashley Banjo and John Barrowman. Another six famous faces make their debut on the ice in the hope of avoiding the skate-off at the end of the show against last week's lowest-scoring performer. There is also a routine by the cast of new musical The Prince of Egypt. The full line-up of celebrities are Ben Hanlin, Caprice, Joe Swash, Ian 'H' Watkins, Kevin Kilbane, Libby Clegg, Lisa George, Lucrezia Millarini, Maura Higgins, Perri Kiely, Trisha Goddard and Radzi Chinyanganya.

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: DCI Vera Stanhope investigates the case of murdered entrepreneur Freddie Gill, whose body is found by bailiffs attempting to repossess his house. As she delves into the case, she soon comes to understand that Freddie's professional life is just as turbulent as his family life, and Vera must uncover whether the motive behind Freddie's death comes from the trouble at the heart of his family, a desperate financial crises, or his glances with organised crime. Starring Brenda Blethyn, Kenny Doughty and Jon Morrison.

programme.title: Bradley Walsh & Son: Breaking Dad
programme.desc: The actor Bradley Walsh and his son Barney return for a second series as they embark on another road trip across America together, beginning their journey in Florida, the southernmost point of the country. From there, the pair head to the Palm Beach International Raceway, before getting up close and personal with sharks.

programme.title: Heathrow: Britain's Busiest Airport
programme.desc: An American airline has one of its busiest days as hundreds of people fly to the USA for Thanksgiving, while Heathrow employee Sunita helps a woman who has lost her two-year old daughter. Ground staff use measures to disperse birds from the runway to prevent any collisions with aircraft, resident paramedic Izzy treats a pregnant passenger suffering from serious abdominal pain who is due to fly to Brazil that day and British Airways employees prepare for the inaugural flight of their new 185 million aircraft the Dreamliner.

programme.title: Liar
programme.desc: Recently single teacher Laura Nielson is set up with Andrew Earlham, a widowed surgeon and the father of one of her students. The two enjoy a first date, but the next day rumours and accusations begin to circulate and the two find themselves entangled in a web of deceit and confusion. Thriller, starring Joanne Froggatt and Ioan Gruffudd, with Shelley Conn, Zoe Tapper and Warren Brown.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Warwick Davis in which a team of five answers questions about top 10 lists from the realms of pop culture and general knowledge, then tries to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: Tony Blackburn talks about the success of BBC Radio 2's Sounds of the 60s Live, which toured the UK throughout 2019 and a raft of new dates have been added for 2020

programme.title: Lorraine
programme.desc: Entertainment, current affairs and fashion news, as well as showbiz stories and celebrity gossip. Presented by Lorraine Kelly.

programme.title: This Morning
programme.desc: A mix of celebrity chat, lifestyle features, advice and competitions.

programme.title: Loose Women

programme.title: STV News and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Dickinson's Real Deal
programme.desc: David and the team are in Milton Keynes, where a ceramic egg attracts David Ford's attention, Tracy Thackray-Howitt buys a gold cigarette case and Mark Stevens eyes up some Iranian portraits in gold.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: Five members of a family from Lancashire answer questions about top 10 lists from the realms of pop culture and general knowledge, then try to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money. Hosted by Warwick Davis.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as contestants James, Joe, Shelley and Helen pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Ryan confronts Graham, Aaron receives troubling news and Jai is feeling the pressure.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Fiz goes back to the police and reveals how she unwittingly bought a gun as part of a house clearance, it disappeared and she panicked. Cathy quizzes Yasmeen about her cleaning obsession, and Aggie confides in Ed that she's considering returning to nursing.

programme.title: The Martin Lewis Money Show
programme.desc: It can get pretty tough in January with Christmas bills flooding through the nation's letterboxes, so the financial journalist and Angellica Bell are on hand to help navigate new regulations relating to overdrafts. Plus, there is a look at consumer rights when asking for a refund.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Cathy confides in Brian how she witnessed Geoff being nasty to Yasmeen, and a tearful Fiz concedes that she'll stay in a B&B so the girls can return home. In an attempt to rebuild their marriage, Steve gets down on one knee and asks Tracy to re-marry him.

programme.title: Cold Feet
programme.desc: Adam finds himself in hot water at work, while his relationship with Karen continues to affect the group. Jenny has finished her cancer treatment, but her struggle is far from over, while David begins to see Mary in a new light. The return of Mike Bullen's comedy drama, starring James Nesbitt, Fay Ripley, Hermione Norris and Robert Bathurst.

programme.title: Scotland Tonight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's headlines from a Scottish perspective, plus local news from Aberdeen, Edinburgh and Glasgow.

programme.title: Welcome to HMP Belmarsh with Ross Kemp
programme.desc: Part one of two. The documentary maker goes inside the walls of HMP Belmarsh, the country's most notorious maximum-security jail, which has housed the country's most dangerous - and infamous - convicts, including Ian Huntley, Ronnie Biggs and Charles Bronson. Ross explores how staff cope with high-profile inmates, extremists and common criminals living side-by-side and goes inside the High Security Unit, where he meets Muhammad Asif Hafeez, known as Sultan, the alleged mastermind of a drug-smuggling empire.

programme.title: Rebound
programme.desc: Sean Fletcher hosts the quickfire quiz that tests the general knowledge of six contestants, who go head to head in a bid to walk away with a big cash prize. The players must give as many correct answers as they can in the time it takes the 'Rebound Bar' to move across the studio, with the money on offer rising accordingly.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: James Martin's French Adventure
programme.desc: The chef's journey continues along the Canal du Midi in southern France, starting in Carcassonne, where he joins the tourists taking in the sights and doing a little shopping. After cooking up a delicious fish stew on the banks of the canal, James hops aboard a boat for a trip towards the coast and is treated to a traditional cuttlefish lunch cooked in the boat's tiny kitchen.

programme.title: Emmerdale

programme.title: The Metro: A Rail Life Story
programme.desc: Documentary following workers on the Tyne and Wear Metro - the UK's largest metro system outside of London. In the first edition, staff in Sunderland prepare for the arrival of 50,000 Spice Girls fans ahead of the pop group's concert at the Stadium of Light. The pressure rises across the day as head of operations Wayne spots a potential fault with an overhead line, and there's an anxious call to the control room - a set of fans have lost their tickets for the concert of a lifetime. Narrated by Zoe Hakin.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Things take a gruesome turn when Ferabbees Circus comes to town, bringing with it a chain of sinister clown sightings, threatening notes and deathly dangerous circus acts. Barnaby has to face up to his fears in order to solve the case. Drama, starring Neil Dudgeon, Nick Hendrix, Lorraine Ashbourne and Annette Badland.

programme.title: White House Farm
programme.desc: Six-part drama based on the true story of the mass murder of a family in an Essex farmhouse in August 1985, providing a fresh insight into these tragic events. In the early hours of August 7th 1985, Nevill and June Bamber were shot and killed inside their farmhouse, along with their adoptive daughter, Sheila Caffell, and Sheila's six-year-old twin sons, Daniel and Nicholas Caffell. Police receive a call from the only surviving member of June and Nevill's immediate family, their adoptive son Jeremy. At first, it appears to be an open-and-shut case to investigating officer DCI Thomas 'Taff' Jones, but for DS Stan Jones, something does not feel right.

programme.title: Masterpiece with Alan Titchmarsh
programme.desc: Alan and co-presenter Rachel Houston-Holland invite more teams of enthusiasts to compete to identify the rarest and most valuable items in stately homes around the country, continuing at Hever Castle in Kent.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: When Brian expresses his concerns for Yasmeen to Geoff, he's quietly seething and makes out that Yasmeen is an alcoholic. David is relieved when the consultant confirms that Shona is slowly emerging from her coma, and Nina warms to Roy when he chats about Hayley.

programme.title: Bradley Walsh & Son: Breaking Dad
programme.desc: For the next leg of their journey, the actor and his son head to the Great Smoky Mountains on the Tennessee-North Carolina border, where they go canoeing on the iconic rapids that featured in the film Deliverance. With Bradley left in need of a whisky, they head to a Hillbilly Jam for a nightcap and to experience the mountain tradition of clog dancing, before the pair try their hand at chopping wood with some competitive lumberjacks and taking to the woods to search for a mythical mountain beast.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Yasmeen listens in disbelief as Peter talks about alcoholism and invites her to join him at one of his meetings. Fiz apologises to David for unwittingly bringing a loaded gun onto the street. Bernie confides in Sean how she's been posing as a 14-year-old boy online to get justice for Paul.

programme.title: White House Farm
programme.desc: Stan and his number two Mick Clark speak to Jeremy and relatives of the murdered family, but their picture of what really happened at White House Farm remains inconclusive. The twins' father Colin Caffell is devastated by his loss, and is initially comforted by Jeremy, while post-mortem examinations reveal nothing to contradict the murder-suicide theory. Meanwhile, relative Ann Eaton cannot believe Sheila was responsible, and discusses her growing suspicions with her brother David Boutflour.

programme.title: Peston

programme.title: The Home Game
programme.desc: A Southampton couple invest 175,000 to modernise their home, while an Australian author plans an enviable loft conversion for her Dartmouth riverfront home. Interior design expert Linda Barker monitors their progress and helps appraise the end results.

programme.desc: TV presenter Stephen Mulhern, X Factor judge Louis Walsh and pop star Rochelle Humes form the panel this week, as Keith Lemon ventures into three more mystery celebrities homes. programme.title: Tonight
programme.sub-title: High Streets: End of the Road? Tonight
programme.desc: A report on the downward trend in spending in Britain's high-street stores over the past 10 years. Geraint Vincent follows typical shopping street Dalton Road in Barrow-in-Furness through the crucial festive period and hears from firms facing high rates and tough competition from the internet and retail parks. But to some, high streets are more than just a place of business - they are a crucial part of the community. Geraint also meets those trying to attract more visitors, and explores whether everyone has a responsibility to support town centres.

programme.title: Welcome to HMP Belmarsh with Ross Kemp
programme.desc: Part two of two. Ross Kemp's report from inside the maximum-security jail takes him to Belmarsh's jail-within-a-jail, where anti-Islamic inmates have to be separated from Islamic prisoners for fear of violence. He also heads to the prison healthcare unit, and meets transgender prisoner Claire Darbyshire, who was given one of the lowest minimum terms for murder in British legal history after killing her father.

programme.title: Gino's Italian Escape
programme.desc: For the final leg of his journey, Gino D'Acampo takes a railway adventure to picturesque Lake Iseo, a hidden gem often overshadowed by its big sisters Garda and Como. He starts out angling for sardines, then takes his catch and prepares a dish of grilled fish for the passengers of Treno dei Sapore - a tourist train that takes guests along the lakeside and into the Franciacorta region. While they enjoy the views they also get a seven-course meal - with today's starter cooked by Gino.

programme.title: Grantchester
programme.desc: When a student from a prestigious all-female college is found dead, Will and Geordie infiltrate the murky world of campus politics and university societies to find the killer. Navigating strange initiations, raucous parties - and with investigative journalist, Ellie Harding, hot on their heels - they need to use every advantage at their disposal to unravel the mystery. Cathy's ambitions for a life of her own start to test the delicate family balance, while fresh from a spell with Daniel in Marrakech, Leonard finds it hard to acclimatise to life back in Grantchester. Robson Green and Tom Brittney star.

programme.title: Who's Doing the Dishes?
programme.desc: Brian McFadden is at the home of pop star and actor Adam Rickitt as he plays host to four strangers in his home. Will Adam avoid the washing up with his cryptic clues as to his identity or will the four diners bag the cash prize and hand the rubber gloves to him?.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: David's thrilled when Shona regains consciousness and tries to speak, until it becomes clear she doesn't recognise him. Paul's horrified when Sean reveals Bernie's plan, and Geoff suggests Yasmeen should steer clear of Speed Daal for a while as she might be tempted to have a drink.

programme.title: The Greek Islands with Julia Bradbury
programme.desc: Julia visits the lush Ionian island of Corfu, beginning in its capital, Corfu Town, where she discovers a surprising, cosmopolitan city more like a little slice of Italy than Greece. After sampling the delights of its famous mumquat flavoured ice-cream, a cookery lesson in making signature savoury dish pastitsada reveals the island's centuries-old love affair with exotic spices. Julia meets a pair of brothers passionate about revolutionising production of Corfu's oldest and most important export - olive oil- and ends her stay trying out the secret to staying young that all Corfiots swear by.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Realising he's been set up by Bernie, Kel makes a grab for her phone. Jade confronts Fiz in the street, and tells her she never intended for her to lose her kids, but she's only got herself to blame. Over their game of chess, Roy puts pressure on Nina to move in.

programme.title: Grantchester
programme.desc: After Will and Leonard witness a deadly and deliberate hit-and-run, Geordie traces the car to a pair of decidedly dysfunctional brothers, whose house lies far off the beaten path. The victim's wife, his employee and the two brothers are all damaged characters caught in a web of lies and betrayals - and it's not just secrets hiding within the siblings' grounds. Back at home, Will and Geordie both struggle as unwelcome guests look set to stay - Will's mum Amelia seems to have found a carbon copy of his late father in her new beau. Meanwhile, a new television set lands in the vicarage - just in time for Eurovision. Robson Green, Tom Brittney and Al Weaver star.

programme.title: The Brits Are Coming

Michael's punishment was reduced to life imprisonment and now, more than six decades later, his niece, Sharon is looking for closure. Michael protested his innocence on his release from prison, but he was never exonerated - can his relative finally clear his name?.
